Takrama...land of stress?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Takrama...land of stress?
By torey luvullo on Saturday, August 17, 2002 - 05:13 pm:

To give myself something to do while dmm-ing my mew [moo], i decided to test something that hayato said in a thread at gamefaqs - that raising a monster in brillia and/or takrama took months off of its life. i had my doubts about brillia, but i had never really raised a monster entirely in takrama.

this was not a scientific study. i chose a sherbet, just because. i did not raise or feed exactly the same; instead, i gave the food it liked most [except for the localizing type] and rested it when it seemed or was a little tired. i never battled, never went on venture. i raised in lif until it maxxed in that stat, then i raised in various combinations of harder drills until it died.

morx and brillia yielded the same results - died with about 2400 composite, at 4 yrs 6 mos. but in takrama, just doing sand swim, at about 1 yr 5 mos, fleria started giving stress reports. she is still doing so [i am not finished raising my takrama sherbet].

now i know sand swim is a tougher lif drill than the other regions'. however, this in and of itself should not be enough to cause so much stress that my regular resting shouldnt cure it...after all, in my other sherbets, doing harder drills than sand swim until tired over and over again didnt cause any stress.

so i am left with an unscientific impression that something about takrama causes stress. when this guy dies young [and i am interested in seeing how young he dies] i will try again with the takrama mocchi, just to see if a local fares better stresswise. i am posting this just to see if any of the other mr3 trainers have ever noticed a takrama stress disadvantage before.

By Bladerunner on Saturday, August 17, 2002 - 05:37 pm:

I am willing to bet your Takrama mocchi will live a normal length life in Takrama. If you want the beginnings of a more thorough research, I'd suggest raising the Takrama one in the other locals too and see which local give it the shorter lifespan.

By torey luvullo on Saturday, August 17, 2002 - 06:44 pm:

well, i am assuming that getting the stress warning means you've already lost a week of lifespan, like in mr2. so i am betting he will live a shorter life than the other 2...but we will see.

By Bladerunner on Saturday, August 17, 2002 - 06:51 pm:

What I'm saying is that the Takrama sub breed will lead a normal life in Takrama, and probably have similar stress problems in one of the other locations, most likely Brillia. I too suspect your Sherbert will lead a shorter life.

By torey luvullo on Saturday, August 17, 2002 - 07:03 pm:

ya - now i understand. that is what i will test next, and i suspect you are right.

By torey luvullo on Sunday, August 18, 2002 - 04:37 pm:

yep - poor little sherbet lived to 4 yrs 4 months and only attained a 2300 composite in takrama.

now, i am giving an anubis [tiger/takrama] the same treatment. started him in takrama...his raising style turned to hardest, but he didnt get the stress message. so three sand swims are obviously tough, but they dont stress out the natives - at least not this one.

By ShadowFusion on Monday, August 19, 2002 - 08:23 am:

Torey, try a few other types of mocchis in Takrama, perhaps one from kalaragi or goat will fair better, or maybe even worse in Takrama. I wonder how rares are affected.

By torey luvullo on Monday, August 19, 2002 - 08:48 am:

well, if i was being scientific, i would do mocchis, but i am sick of mocchis. so i am going to take tigers around the sites now.

By torey luvullo on Thursday, August 22, 2002 - 06:05 pm:

interesting, if entirely anecdotal and nonconclusive, results. the anubis did equally well in takrama and in brillia. indeed he did a hair better in brillia, but not enough to be statistically significant. oh well, on to morx with the travelling tiger...
